message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about measuring tools. Calculating a short distance can be accomplished with a yard stick, as it is a tool specifically designed for measuring lengths. Options (B) and (C) are incorrect because they do not involve any tools for measurement. Option (D) is incorrect because a penny is not a suitable tool for measuring distances.

Option (B) is incorrect because thoughts cannot physically measure distance. Option (C) is possible but not as precise as using a measurement tool. Option (D) is unrelated to measurement and not a suitable tool for calculating distance.

This question requires understanding of different tools or methods used to measure short distances. Option (A) is the correct answer because a yardstick is a measuring tool specifically designed to measure short distances. Option (B) is incorrect because while we may estimate short distances with our thoughts, it is not a precise form of measurement. Option (C) is incorrect because touch can only give us a general sense of distance, but not an exact measurement. Option (D) is incorrect because a penny is not a tool used for measuring distance.
